definition: to seize/to clutch/to grab firmly and pull

sentences.english: The film about the death of a young child was one that really tugged at my heartstrings.

definition: to feel distressed about sth/heartache/cardiac pain
to love dearly/to feel sorry for sb/to regret/to grudge/to be distressed
to be vexed or annoyed/to feel queasy
to feel sad/to feel unwell/(of life) to be difficult
to grieve/to be broken-hearted/to feel deeply hurt
to feel unwell/to suffer pain/to be difficult to bear
to regret/to feel that it is a great pity/to feel sorry for sb
